intro: Hieracium stadaeum, commonly known as the Stadean hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It features yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually hairy and lobed. Hieracium stadaeum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often found in temperate climates.
